lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
Duke is __a desktop app for managing tasks,
optimized for use via a Command Line Interface__ (CLI).
This application aims to help the user store tasks and trace the status of tasks.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` or above installed in your Computer.
1. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your *Duke*.
1. Open the terminal in this folder. Type `java -jar Duke.jar` and press enter, to start this application.
1. Type the command in the terminal and press Enter to execute it.
Some example commands you can try:
* `todo finish homework` : Adds a Todo "finish homework" to the task list.
* `find homework` : Prints all tasks having the keyword in the description
1. Refer to the [Features](#features) below for details of each command.
* Words in `UPPER_CASE` are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in todo `DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo do something`.
Adds a Todo to the task list.
Adds an Event to the task list.
Note the format for `TIME` should be `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm`
Adds a deadline to the task list.
Note the format for `TIME` should be `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm`
Prints all tasks in the list.
Prints all tasks in the list that contains the keyword that the user want.
Deletes the task with the given index.
Marks the task with the given index as done.
Prints all tasks in the list that happens on a certain date.
**Q**: How do I transfer my data to another Computer?
**A**: Install the app in the other computer and overwrite the data\tasks.txt file it creates with the file that contains your previous data.
Add Todo | `todo DESCRIPTION`  e.g.`todo do something`
Add Event | `event DESCRIPTION /at TIME`   e.g.`event meeting /at 2020-10-01 13:00`
Add Deadline | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by TIME`   e.g.`deadline submitting homework /by 2020-10-01 23:59`
Find Task on Date | `date DATE`   e.g.`date 2020-10-01`
* Represents the command call when the user adds some task.
* Adds the task, and update the file.
* @throws DukeException the exceptions can happen in this function, to be handled based on the specific exception
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
* Represents the command to be executed.
* Execute the command based on the specific command type.
* @throws DukeException the exceptions can happen in this program, to be handled based on the specific exception
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;

* Delete the task, and update the file.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

* Mark the task as done, and update the file.
* @throws DukeException the exceptions can happen in this function, to be handled based on the specific exception
public void execute(TaskList tasks, UI ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {

* Represents all exceptions that may happen in this project
* that should be handled in UI.
* Prepare the message to be printed when the exception is experienced.
* Generally, DukeException should not be thrown in this program.

return " OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.";
* Represents the case when the user types delete but do not specify

return " OOPS!!! You should enter the index of the task you want to delete.";

return " OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.";

return " OOPS!!! You should enter a time for event.";

return "Sorry, there isn't such task in the list with the given keyword.";

* This class contains one function -- parse, to call the respective command function according to the user input.
* This function calls the correct command the user want to perform, by returning a <\code>Command</\code> object.
* @param fullCommand the full string of user input
* @return the specific <\code>Command</\code> object to perform what the user want to do
* @throws DukeException includes all exceptions may happen during parsing
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
// this block deals with exit and list command
//this block deals with find date command
int taskIndex;//to indicate what is the task we are dealing with. may not be used.
//we shall check that the user input is not meant for any other command beforehand
//because the default block will throw an exception.
// i.e. when enter this block, the parser will not go to any other blocks
return new AddCommand(new Event(fullCommand.substring(6, dividerPosition), LocalDateTime.parse(dateTime)));
return new AddCommand(new Deadline(fullCommand.substring(9, dividerPosition), LocalDateTime.parse(dateTime)));
